content:
We have 'displayLanguage' on ExpansionProfile.
And then we document a displayLanguage parameter override on the $expand operation itself.
but what about the accept-language on the HTTP request?
I think we should say that this is the fall back if neither of the displayLanguages is specified
and I have a question about expansion in the context of LOINC.

1: the LOINC translations are incomplete. What happens if you ask for an expansion on a LOINC value set in a non-english language, and there are codes in the expansion for which no code exists in the specified language. I'm falling back to english, because what else can I do?
2. can we confirm that for LOINC, the filters are always in english based, irrespective of the language specified in the value set or for the expansion?
I am doing an $expand on a value set. If includes specified displays - like this:

<compose> 
    <include> 
      <system value="http://loinc.org"/> 
      <concept> 
        <code value="11369-6"/> 
        <display value="History of Immunization"/> 
      </concept>

the language of the resource is 

<language value="en"/>
what should be returned in this case? the specified display, or the correct chinese display
@Michael Lawley @John Gresh @Peter Jordan @Rob Hausam @Ted Klein @Yunwei Wang @Russ Hamm - calling your attention to these 3 multi-lingual questions

IMHO (but this should be further discussed), an unprofiled expand should return what is in the definition (the display in <compose> is part of the VSD), plus what is requested by the API operation (if it exists; a language may be requested in an expand on an intensional definition where some of the expanded concepts do not have displays in the requested language). An expand profile should have be ability to specify if the expansion should contain the concept code and only the requested display. So I'm suggesting that the default is to give what is in the VSD if specified in an extensional PLUS what is requested in the argument, but make sure a profile can tighten that on request.
My server will return an OperationOutcome if a displayLanguage parameter, with any value other than "en-NZ", is passed in requests for a ValueSet $expand, $validate-code or a CodeSystem $lookup.
I'd first like to better understand the range of use-cases that people are imagining for these displayLanguage-based requests
well, there's the obvious UI ones: my user interface is in chinese..
